Chronic Rhinosinusitis with Nasal Polypo:
Patient Description 1:
    A 45-year-old male, with a history of comorbid asthma, presented with a persistent complaint of smell loss, rated at 7/10 in severity, which he has been experiencing for the past 6 months. The smell loss is accompanied by bilateral nasal obstruction, thick nasal drainage, and facial pressure. The patient reported acute respiratory reactions, including coughing and wheezing, upon the intake of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. His asthma condition has been relatively stable, managed with an inhaled corticosteroid. The duration of symptoms, comorbid asthma, and the observed acute respiratory reactions to nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are critical factors in the diagnostic assessment.

Patient Description 2:
    A 50-year-old female patient presented with a 9-month history of chronic nasal symptoms. She reported a complete smell loss, rated at 8/10 in severity, along with persistent bilateral nasal obstruction and thick nasal drainage. The patient's quality of life has been significantly impacted by these symptoms. She denied any history of asthma but reported a long-term use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs for osteoarthritis. The duration and severity of her smell loss, in conjunction with the nasal obstruction and thick drainage, necessitate a comprehensive diagnostic evaluation.

Patient Description 3:
    A 55-year-old male patient, without a history of asthma, reported recurrent sinus and nasal complaints. He described a gradual onset of smell loss, rated at 6/10 in severity, which he has been experiencing for the past 8 months. The smell loss is accompanied by bilateral nasal obstruction, thick nasal drainage, and facial pressure. The patient also reported a history of acute respiratory reactions, manifesting as wheezing, associated with the use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. The duration of symptoms, along with the observed respiratory reactions to medication, are crucial in the diagnostic assessment for this patient.
